definitions.definition: relating to crime.
definitions.example: he is charged with conspiracy to commit criminal damage

definitions.definition: a time of intense difficulty or danger.
definitions.example: the current economic crisis

definitions.definition: (of a substance) firm, dry, and brittle.
definitions.example: crisp bacon

definitions.definition: (of the weather) cool, fresh, and invigorating.
definitions.example: a crisp autumn day

definitions.definition: give (food) a crisp surface by placing it in an oven or under a grill.
definitions.example: crisp the pitta in the oven

definitions.definition: (of a way of speaking) briskly decisive and matter-of-fact, without hesitation or unnecessary detail.
definitions.example: her answer was crisp

definitions.definition: a dessert of fruit baked with a crunchy topping of brown sugar, butter, and flour.
definitions.example: rhubarb crisp

definitions.definition: a principle or standard by which something may be judged or decided.
definitions.example: they award a green label to products that meet certain environmental criteria

definitions.definition: expressing adverse or disapproving comments or judgements.
definitions.example: I was very critical of the previous regime

definitions.definition: (of a situation or problem) having the potential to become disastrous; at a point of crisis.
definitions.example: the floodwaters had not receded and the situation was still critical

definitions.definition: (of a nuclear reactor or fuel) maintaining a self-sustaining chain reaction.
definitions.example: the reactor is due to go critical in October

definitions.definition: expressing or involving an analysis of the merits and faults of a work of literature, music, or art.
definitions.example: she never won the critical acclaim she sought

definitions.definition: the expression of disapproval of someone or something on the basis of perceived faults or mistakes.
definitions.example: he received a lot of criticism

definitions.definition: the analysis and judgement of the merits and faults of a literary or artistic work.
definitions.example: alternative methods of criticism supported by well-developed literary theories

definitions.definition: indicate the faults of (someone or something) in a disapproving way.
definitions.example: the opposition criticized the government's failure to consult adequately

definitions.definition: form and express a judgement of (a literary or artistic work).
definitions.example: a literary text may be criticized on two grounds: the semantic and the expressive

definitions.definition: the entire tanned hide of an animal.
a group or amount of related people or things appearing or occurring at one time.
definitions.example: the current crop of politicians

definitions.definition: cut (something, especially a person's hair) very short.
definitions.example: cropped blonde hair

definitions.definition: a hairstyle in which the hair is cut very short.
definitions.example: she has her hair cut in a short crop

definitions.definition: harvest (plants or their produce) from a particular area.
definitions.example: hay would have been cropped several times through the summer

definitions.definition: a cultivated plant that is grown on a large scale commercially, especially a cereal, fruit, or vegetable.
definitions.example: the main crops were oats and barley

definitions.definition: a pouch in a bird's gullet where food is stored or prepared for digestion.
definitions.example: the parent waxbill partially digests food in its crop
